parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
A primary particle; opposite, i.e. Instead or because of.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pro and noieo; to consider in advance, i.e. Look out for beforehand.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
